actor_awards.notes: An Egyptian actor who became an international star. He won two Golden Globes (Best Supporting Actor and New Star of the Year) for Lawrence of Arabia and one for Best Actor for Doctor Zhivago. He was also a world-renowned bridge player.

filmography.title: Lawrence of Arabia
filmography.role_description: A fierce Bedouin tribal leader who becomes a close ally and friend to T.E. Lawrence during the Arab Revolt.
filmography.plot: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I in order to fight the Turks.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actor, New Star of the Year; Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Doctor Zhivago
filmography.role_description: A Russian physician and poet who is torn between two women while caught in the turmoil of the Russian Revolution.
filmography.plot: The life of a Russian physician and poet who, although married to another, falls in love with a political activist's wife and experiences hardship during the First World War and then the October Revolution.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor in a Motion Picture - Drama

filmography.title: Funny Girl
filmography.role_description: A suave professional gambler who charms and marries the rising star Fanny Brice, but struggles with his own failings.
filmography.plot: The life of comedienne Fanny Brice, from her early days in the Jewish slums of the Lower East Side to the height of her career with the Ziegfeld Follies, including her marriage to and eventual divorce from Nick Arnstein.

filmography.title: Monsieur Ibrahim
filmography.role_description: An elderly Turkish shopkeeper in Paris who befriends a lonely Jewish boy and teaches him the ways of the world and Sufism.
filmography.plot: In Paris, a Turkish shopkeeper befriends a Jewish boy, becoming his father figure and guiding him through life.

filmography.title: The Night of the Generals
filmography.role_description: A tenacious German intelligence officer determined to find a serial killer among the Nazi high command.
filmography.plot: A German intelligence officer investigates the murder of a prostitute in Warsaw and suspects three generals.

filmography.title: Mackenna's Gold
filmography.role_description: A charismatic and ruthless Mexican outlaw who forces a marshal to lead him to a legendary valley of gold.
filmography.plot: A gangster kidnaps a marshal who knows the location of a legendary stash of gold, leading to a tense expedition.

filmography.title: Top Secret!
filmography.role_description: A British secret agent who works with the French Resistance, often displaying bizarre gadgets.
filmography.plot: Parody of WWII spy movies in which an American rock and roll singer becomes involved in a Resistance plot to rescue a scientist imprisoned in East Germany.

filmography.title: The 13th Warrior
filmography.role_description: A loyal translator and mentor who accompanies an exiled Arab ambassador on a journey with Vikings.
filmography.plot: A man, having fallen in love with the wrong woman, is sent by the Sultan himself on a diplomatic mission to a distant land as an ambassador.

filmography.title: Hidalgo
filmography.role_description: A wealthy sheikh who owns the 'Ocean of Fire' race and challenges an American cowboy.
filmography.plot: In 1890, a down-and-out cowboy and his mustang travel to Arabia to compete in a legendary cross-desert horse race.

filmography.title: Juggernaut
filmography.role_description: The captain of a luxury ocean liner who must manage the panic when the ship is threatened by bombs.
filmography.plot: Bombs are planted on a luxury liner, and a ransom is demanded. An expert bomb disposal team is parachuted onto the ship to defuse them.

filmography.title: The Tamarind Seed
filmography.role_description: A Soviet military attaché who falls in love with a British Home Office assistant during the Cold War.
filmography.plot: A British Home Office assistant and a Soviet military attaché fall in love during a holiday in Barbados, complicating international relations.

filmography.title: The Last Valley
filmography.role_description: A former teacher fleeing the Thirty Years' War who finds a hidden valley untouched by the conflict.
filmography.plot: During the Thirty Years' War, a drifting mercenary captain and a teacher stumble upon a village untouched by the war.

filmography.title: The Fall of the Roman Empire
filmography.role_description: The King of Armenia who is forced to marry the sister of Emperor Commodus.
filmography.plot: The death of Marcus Aurelius leads to a succession crisis, in which his son Commodus demonstrates that he is unwilling to let anything undermine his claim to the Roman Empire.

filmography.title: Behold a Pale Horse
filmography.role_description: A priest who faces a moral dilemma when asked to lure a Spanish guerrilla leader into a trap.
filmography.plot: A former Spanish guerrilla is forced out of exile when a corrupt police captain holds his mother hostage.

filmography.title: The Horsemen
filmography.role_description: The proud son of a master horseman who risks his life in the dangerous game of buzkashi.
filmography.plot: In Afghanistan, a horseman breaks his leg in a competition and must endure a treacherous journey home to regain his honor.

filmography.title: The Yellow Rolls-Royce
filmography.role_description: A Yugoslav partisan who uses the titular car to transport other partisans during World War II.
filmography.plot: Three stories about the lives and loves of those who own a certain yellow Rolls-Royce.

filmography.title: Funny Lady
filmography.role_description: Sharif reprises his role as Fanny Brice's ex-husband, who re-enters her life.
filmography.plot: The further adventures of Fanny Brice, detailing her marriage to showman Billy Rose.

filmography.title: Genghis Khan
filmography.role_description: The Mongol conqueror who unites the tribes to form a vast empire.
filmography.plot: The story of the young Temujin, who battles rival tribes and eventually becomes the legendary Genghis Khan.

filmography.title: Mayerling
filmography.role_description: The Austrian prince who enters into a tragic suicide pact with his mistress.
filmography.plot: The tragic love story of Crown Prince Rudolf of Austria and his mistress Baroness Mary Vetsera.

filmography.title: More Than a Miracle
filmography.role_description: A Spanish prince who must choose a bride but falls for a beautiful peasant girl.
filmography.plot: A Spanish prince is ordered to choose a wife from among seven princesses but falls in love with a peasant girl instead.

filmography.title: The Burglars
filmography.role_description: A corrupt police commissioner who pursues a group of emerald thieves.
filmography.plot: A group of burglars steal emeralds from a villa, but a corrupt police inspector is hot on their trail.

filmography.title: Siraa Fil-Wadi (The Blazing Sun)
filmography.role_description: A young agricultural engineer who helps farmers improve their crops. Sharif's film debut.
filmography.plot: A conflict arises between a pasha and his nephew, with a young engineer caught in the middle.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nomination - Grand Prize of the Festival

filmography.title: Rock the Casbah
filmography.role_description: The recently deceased patriarch of a family who appears as a ghost to observe his funeral.
filmography.plot: A family gathers for the funeral of their patriarch, but tensions rise as secrets are revealed.

filmography.title: Peter the Great
filmography.role_description: A loyal advisor to the Tsar in this historical miniseries.
filmography.plot: The life and reign of Peter I of Russia, who dragged his country out of the dark ages and into modern Europe.

filmography.title: One Night with the King
filmography.role_description: A Persian prince and advisor to the King in this biblical drama.
filmography.plot: A young Jewish girl, Esther, becomes the Queen of Persia and must save her people from annihilation.
